meanings.definition: The action of taking out something, especially using force or effort.
meanings.sent1: The extraction of a splinter from my finger was painful.
meanings.sent2: The miners completed the extraction of coal from the earth.
meanings.sent3: During the extraction of the toy from the cereal box, it flew across the room!
meanings.sent4: Her extraction of information from the suspect was like pulling teeth.
meanings.sent5: The extraction of the key from the lock required a lot of twisting and turning.

meanings.definition: The process of obtaining something from a substance or mixture by physical or chemical means.
meanings.sent1: The extraction of juice from the orange was done using a juicer.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use extraction to separate compounds in a laboratory.
meanings.sent3: The extraction of the last cookie from the jar was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The extraction of knowledge from books is a lifelong pursuit.
meanings.sent5: The extraction of oil from olives is a key step in making olive oil.

meanings.definition: The act of removing a tooth or other body part.
meanings.sent1: The dentist performed an extraction of my wisdom tooth.
meanings.sent2: The extraction of a damaged tooth can relieve pain.
meanings.sent3: During the extraction of the splinter, I accidentally pulled out two hairs!
meanings.sent4: His extraction of the thorn from his finger was swift and precise.
meanings.sent5: The extraction of the nail from the wood required a lot of strength.
